title: 'Door jammed': How bike collision caused Hyderabad–Bengaluru bus to burst into flames - Key details
content: Tragedy struck in Kurnool as a private bus fire claimed at least 20 lives after colliding with a bike. Passengers were trapped as the blaze spread rapidly, with many unable to escape due to jammed doors.  This devastating incident follows a similar bus fire in Rajasthan, highlighting critical safety concerns.

title: WH flags 'disturbing pattern' after Indian trucker crash in California
content: A tragic collision in California, which involved a truck driver identified as an undocumented immigrant from India, has ignited a White House inquiry into the commercial licensing process. Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding the driver’s licensing, highlighting concerns over undocumented individuals acquiring such permits. This incident has reignited discussions on the intersection of immigration policy and roadway safety regulations.

title: Bihar polls: Tejashwi hits back at PM Modi's ‘jungle raj’ jibe
content: Tejashwi Yadav, Mahagathbandhan's CM candidate, hit back at the NDA. He questioned Prime Minister Narendra Modi's record on scams. Tejashwi also pointed to high crime rates in BJP-ruled states. He alleged that the BJP focuses more on Gujarat than Bihar. The verbal duel intensifies as Bihar gears up for polls.

title: PSL team owner tears up legal notice; mocks Pakistan board on camera
content: Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen defiantly responded to a PCB legal notice, which threatened a lifetime ban for criticizing PSL management. Tareen, who has raised concerns about communication and transparency, tore up the notice in a video, questioning the PCB's competence.  This highlights ongoing franchise owner tensions and accountability issues within Pakistan cricket.

title: Stephen Hawking on AI: Artificial Intelligence risks; humanity’s future
content: Theoretical physicist Stephen Hawking recognized AI's immense potential to solve global challenges and improve lives. However, he also issued stark warnings about its risks, particularly the possibility of AI evolving beyond human control and posing an existential threat to civilization. Hawking urged for responsible development and strict ethical oversight to ensure AI benefits humanity.

title: ‘We shattered windows to survive’: Survivors recount terrifying bus blaze; 20 dead
content: A private bus travelling from Hyderabad to Bengaluru caught fire near Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh, after colliding with a bike. The incident, which occurred around 3 AM, resulted in at least 20 fatalities as passengers struggled to escape due to locked doors and a lack of safety equipment.

title: Not Gukesh or Pragg! India pin Freestyle Chess Finals hopes on one star
content: India's Arjun Erigaisi will be the sole Indian representative at the inaugural Freestyle Chess Grand Slam Finals in South Africa this December. Competing against a star-studded field including Magnus Carlsen, the young Indian prodigy faces a unique challenge in the randomized starting position format. This event promises a blend of intense chess and cultural celebration.

title: 'Browser with ChatGPT at core': OpenAI launches 'GPT Atlas'; what it didn't tell
content: OpenAI's new ChatGPT Atlas browser, touted as a revolutionary AI-powered navigation tool, has been revealed to be built on Google's Chromium, the same open-source technology underpinning Chrome and other browsers. Despite claims of challenging Chrome's dominance, Atlas integrates AI features like ChatGPT sidebars and "browser memories" onto a familiar foundation. This move places Atlas alongside other AI-enhanced browsers like Perplexity's Comet, all leveraging Google's existing browser architecture rather than introducing entirely new technology.

title: Trump says he's ending trade talks with Canada over TV ads
content: President Trump has halted all trade negotiations with Canada, citing a recent advertisement featuring Ronald Reagan protesting US tariffs as "egregious behavior." The $75 million Ontario-funded ad uses Reagan's words to warn against trade barriers. The Ronald Reagan Foundation has dismissed the ad as a misrepresentation and is considering legal action.

title: Kerala football fan spends night in jail for hugging Ronaldo's teammate
content: A passionate FC Goa fan faced legal trouble after breaching security to hug Portuguese star Joao Felix and snap a selfie during an AFC Champions League match. The fan spent a night in jail, with authorities deleting the photo and filing a case. FC Goa now faces a potential $10,000 fine from the AFC due to the security lapse.

title: British influencer admits injuring girl during Diwali fireworks in Delhi
content: British content creator Sam Pepper sparked outrage after a video showed him allegedly firing firecrackers at children, injuring one. He later admitted to the accidental injury during Diwali festivities, stating a girl sustained a cut above her eyebrow. Social media users condemned his actions, with reports of platform suspensions following the incident.

title: AI browser battle begins: Microsoft unveils Copilot Mod; rivals ChatGPT Atlas
content: Microsoft has launched Copilot Mode in Edge, an AI assistant integrated directly into its browser, positioning it as a rival to OpenAI's newly announced ChatGPT Atlas. This intelligent companion can view and reason over open tabs, summarize information, and perform actions, intensifying the AI browser race between the two 'frenemies'.

title: Piyush Pandey passes away: Veteran ad executive dies at 70
content: India mourns the loss of advertising legend Piyush Pandey, who passed away at 70.  Renowned for crafting unforgettable campaigns for brands like Asian Paints, Cadbury, Fevicol, and Hutch, Pandey transformed advertising into a cultural phenomenon. His creative genius left an indelible mark on the Indian advertising landscape, making his work instantly recognizable and deeply cherished by the public.

title: Puri teen dies after train hits him while making reel near railway track
content: Tragedy struck near Puri's Jankadeipur station when a 15-year-old boy, Biswajit Sahoo, was fatally struck by a train. He was attempting to film a social media reel near the tracks. The incident, captured on video, has circulated widely online. Local residents attempted to help, but he was declared dead at the hospital.

title: Google hits new milestone: CEO Sundar Pichai celebrates; Elon Musk responds
content: Google's Willow chip has achieved a verifiable quantum advantage, running a new algorithm 13,000 times faster than the best supercomputers. This breakthrough, named Quantum Echoes, can explain atomic interactions and paves the way for drug discovery and materials science. The verifiable result marks a significant step towards real-world quantum computing applications.

title: Big shake-up! Australia announce squad changes midway through India series
content: Glenn Maxwell is back for Australia's T20 series against India after a wrist fracture. Young fast bowler Mahli Beardman has earned a surprise call-up for a potential debut. Several players are heading to Sheffield Shield matches to prepare for the Ashes. As Australia gear up for the upcoming T20I series, several changes to the squad have been confirmed.

title: Delhi's air quality slightly improves; Anand Vihar remains in 'severe' zone
content: Delhi's air quality saw a slight improvement on Friday morning, moving from 'very poor' to 'poor' with an overall AQI of 290. However, Anand Vihar remained in the 'severe' category at 403, with fifteen other stations still reporting 'very poor' air quality.

title: Harvard study reveals surprising link between nail growth and aging
content: Harvard-trained longevity doctor David Sinclair suggests nail growth can be a surprising indicator of biological age. A 1979 study found nail growth slows by approximately 0.5% annually after age 25, declining by 50% over a lifespan, reflecting reduced cellular regeneration. This, along with other factors, offers insights into how well the body is aging.

title: Ahead of JNU elections, ‘I love Muhammad’ graffiti and posters appear
content: Graffiti and posters proclaiming "I Love Mohammad" appeared across Jawaharlal Nehru University overnight, sparking concern among officials. Removed by morning, the messages, found near Barak Hostel and the Open Air Theatre, are being investigated. The university views the incident seriously, especially with JNUSU elections approaching, fearing it could incite communal disharmony.

title: When Jaya said she loves Dharmendra in front of Hema, called him 'Greek God'
content: Jaya Bachchan's acting debut at 15 led to her iconic Bollywood role in 'Guddi', where she played a Dharmendra fan.  Decades later, the duo reunited for 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani', reigniting their bond. Dharmendra fondly recalls Jaya as his 'Guddi', a sentiment she playfully dismisses, highlighting their enduring connection.

title: ‘We’re police, you have ganja’: Woman gang-raped, robbed by men posing as cops in Bengaluru; 3 held
content: In a shocking incident near Nelamangala, Bengaluru Rural police have arrested three young men following the horrific gang-rape of a 27-year-old woman. The survivor recounted how five men, masquerading as law enforcement, forcefully invaded her home, brutalized both her and another woman, and stole their possessions.

title: Father bobbitises man accused of raping his daughter; accused was his homosexual partner
content: A 28-year-old man accused of raping a six-year-old girl was allegedly bobbitised by the survivor's father. The incident occurred in Deoria's Khukhundu area, with the accused now in critical condition and receiving treatment. Police have registered a case under the Pocso Act against the accused.

title: 'Maa kasam khao': Did Chahal take a dig at Dhanashree, Delhi HC? Insta Story goes viral
content: Yuzvendra Chahal's cryptic Instagram Story about alimony follows his divorce from Dhanashree Verma, finalised with a Rs 4.75 crore payout. Earlier in the year, Chahal had revealed the couple maintained a public facade during their separation, citing differing ambitions and life goals. He also shared his struggles with mental health and suicidal thoughts post-divorce.

title: 'System spammed with fraud': White House' latest justification on H-1B visa fee hike
content: The Trump administration is preparing to defend a new $100,000 H-1B visa fee in court, facing lawsuits from the US Chamber of Commerce and other groups. The administration argues the fee is necessary to protect American workers and combat fraud in the visa system, which they claim has been exploited for years.

title: 'Vote chori' row: Over 6,000 voters deleted for Rs 80 each in Aland, says SIT; Cong hits out at BJP
content: Karnataka police's SIT has uncovered evidence of a voter deletion scam in Aland, with six suspects identified. Allegations suggest over 6,000 votes, primarily targeting Dalit and minority voters, were removed from electoral rolls between December 2022 and February 2023 for a fee of Rs 80 per application. Investigations are ongoing.

title: White House East Wing demolished for Trump’s $300M ballroom – see photos
content: The East Wing of the White House is now rubble. Donald Trump's new ballroom project is underway. This massive structure will cost $300 million. Funding comes entirely from private donors. Tech giants and prominent investors are contributing. Taxpayers will not bear any cost for this significant White House upgrade.

title: At least 20 dead as bus catches fire on Hyderabad-Bengaluru highway
content: A private bus operated by Kaveri Travels caught fire on the Hyderabad–Bengaluru highway near Kurnool, with at least 32 people feared dead. The blaze erupted after the bus collided with a motorcycle, trapping passengers inside. Rescue efforts are ongoing as officials work to confirm the exact casualty count.

title: Kajol & Twinkle Khanna get trolled for their physical infidelity comment
content: A talk show segment featuring Janhvi Kapoor, Karan Johar, Kajol, and Twinkle Khanna ignited a debate on infidelity. While Kapoor insisted physical cheating is unforgivable, Johar, Kajol, and Khanna suggested it's not a deal-breaker, drawing criticism from netizens and a psychologist who labeled their view as emotional suppression and normalization of disrespect.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for October 24, 2025 - check list
content: Bajaj Broking Research highlights Inox Wind and Zaggle Prepaid Ocean Services as top stock picks for October 24, 2025. The Nifty and Bank Nifty are showing bullish momentum, with potential for further gains despite overbought conditions.

title: Mohsin Naqvi’s audacity: 'Whole India running behind trophy now' goes viral- Watch
content: Pakistan's Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi is being hailed as a hero for his handling of the Asia Cup trophy. A viral clip shows him being praised for his 'patience' when the Indian team allegedly refused to collect their trophy, and for later taking it in his car.

title: 'Aaj farewell match tha': Gautam Gambhir’s remark to Rohit Sharma sparks intense fan discussion
content: A viral social media clip shows Gautam Gambhir seemingly joking with Rohit Sharma about a potential farewell match during India's ODI series against Australia. Despite earlier criticism, Rohit bounced back with a determined 73 in the second ODI, showcasing his enduring form and resilience amidst ongoing speculation about his future in the 2027 World Cup squad.

title: Man stabbed to death after switching off loud music at Kali Puja pandal
content: A peaceful gesture during a festive celebration turned deadly in Sonarpur, where Sanatan Naskar, 35, was fatally attacked after he attempted to silence the overpowering music of a Kali Puja pandal. After responding to a neighborhood complaint about the noise, Naskar found himself facing the wrath of festive revellers who launched a dangerous assault on him and his loved ones.

title: Alaska Airlines ground all flights: What caused the nationwide disruption?
content: Alaska Airlines and its subsidiary Horizon Air grounded all flights nationwide due to an "IT outage affecting operations." The Federal Aviation Administration issued a temporary ground stop for approximately 1 hour and 10 minutes. This marks the second IT disruption for the airline this year, impacting its extensive network.

title: ‘At Trump’s request’: White House claims India, China 'scaling back' Russian oil imports
content: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt stated that India has reduced Russian oil imports at President Trump's request, with China also scaling back purchases. Trump previously claimed India would cease Russian oil imports by year-end. India, however, has denied any policy shift, prioritizing consumer interests.

title: Who Is Oronde Gadsden II? Inside Chargers TE’s Journey to the NFL
content: Despite recent struggles for the Los Angeles Chargers, rookie tight end Oronde Gadsden II has emerged as a bright spot. Following in his NFL father's footsteps, Gadsden transitioned to tight end at Syracuse and has become a key target for Justin Herbert, showing flashes of dominance that could reshape the Chargers' offense.

title: 'Criminal illegal aliens being issued licenses': What WH said on California crash — Watch
content: A tragic California crash, claiming three lives, has sparked White House criticism. Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt highlighted that the Indian-origin driver, Jashanpreet Singh, an undocumented immigrant, had been issued a commercial vehicle license by California.  ICE had lodged detainers for Singh, who entered the US in 2022 and was released by the previous administration.

title: Shocking! 'I could have died in hours' — Tilak Varma opens up on life-threatening illness
content: India's Asia Cup 2025 hero, Tilak Varma, revealed a serious health scare in 2022 when diagnosed with rhabdomyolysis, a condition causing rapid muscle breakdown. He credited Mumbai Indians and Akash Ambani for crucial medical support during the crisis, which he narrowly survived due to prompt treatment.

title: Ayesha Curry once shut down open marriage rumors about her and Stephen Curry
content: Fans are speculating about Stephen Curry's marriage after his wife Ayesha Curry made recent comments on a podcast. She previously defended their relationship against rumors of an open marriage. Curry's remarks about not wanting children or marriage have sparked online debate. The couple has not publicly addressed the current fan reactions.

title: NBA betting scandal: FBI probe widens as more teams, players face arrest
content: The NBA is reeling from an extensive FBI investigation into illegal sports gambling involving players, coaches, and personnel. Several high-profile figures, including Terry Rozier, Chauncey Billups, and Damon Jones, have been arrested for allegedly leaking confidential information and participating in Mafia-linked poker rings. The probe exposes deep ties between professional sports and organized crime, raising serious questions about league integrity.

title: Justin Herbert injury update: Chargers QB cleared to play vs Vikings tonight
content: Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert is set to play against the Minnesota Vikings tonight.  He is not on the injury report.  Herbert has a history of injuries but appears fit.  He spoke about the Vikings' strong defense and their star player Harrison Smith.  The game starts at 5:15 p.m. PDT at SoFi Stadium.

title: Jaz Agassi shares sweet post as Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf mark 24 years
content: Tennis legends Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf celebrated 24 years of marriage, with daughter Jaz sharing a touching public tribute. Agassi marked the occasion with a nostalgic post featuring a Wimbledon throwback. Fans and fellow athletes lauded their enduring partnership, highlighting their strong bond and private life in Las Vegas with their children.

title: US confirms Trump-Xi meet; Democrats find it 'outrageous' - here's why
content: Amidst a prolonged government shutdown, Democrats are urging President Trump to cancel his upcoming Asia trip, including a meeting with China's Xi Jinping. Critics argue the President should prioritize domestic issues and the suffering of Americans over international diplomacy. Past presidents have canceled foreign travel during similar crises, a precedent Democrats hope Trump will follow.

title: Rohit Sharma takes charge mid-match, provides tactical tips while Shubman Gill sets field
content: Rohit Sharma, despite not being the official ODI captain, actively guided Washington Sundar with tactical advice during a match against Australia. This leadership display, coupled with his patient 73-run innings, highlighted his continued influence on team strategy and decision-making, even without the captain's armband.

title: Fans defend Anushka after she faces backlash over Kohli's ODI ducks
content: Actress Anushka Sharma is again facing online attacks due to her husband Virat Kohli's recent cricket scores. Trolls are blaming her for his performance, a pattern seen for years. Fans are defending Sharma, calling out the misogyny. This online harassment has led some to suggest it's why the couple moved to London.

title: Source: Bettors allegedly given LeBron injury info
content: Former player Damon Jones was arrested amid charges he allegedly disclosed injury info about Lakers star LeBron James, a source told ESPN, to facilitate illegal betting.

title: Billups, Rozier arrested in gambling investigations
content: Trail Blazers coach Chauncey Billups and Heat guard Terry Rozier have been arrested as part of a pair of investigations related to illegal sports betting and rigged poker games backed by the Mafia, authorities announced.

title: McCarthy nears return as Wentz fights pain in loss
content: Vikings coach Kevin O'Connell reaffirmed his commitment to getting J.J. McCarthy back on the field as soon as possible, saying he believes his return is "right around the corner."

title: Dolphins' Hill undecided on retirement after injury
content: Dolphins star receiver Tyreek Hill hasn't yet decided if he's done playing football after suffering a season-ending knee injury against the Jets on Sept 29.

title: Vesia not with Dodgers due to personal matter
content: Alex Vesia, one of the Dodgers' most trusted relievers, is dealing with a personal matter that has put his World Series availability in doubt.

title: Sources: SEC suspends Georgia-Auburn referee
content: The SEC has suspended longtime referee Ken Williamson for the remainder of the season in the wake of his crew's performance in Georgia's 20-10 victory at Auburn on Oct. 11, sources confirmed to ESPN on Thursday.

title: Reaves' fight with Rempe fires up Sharks in win
content: Matt Rempe and Ryan Reaves had the Madison Square Garden crowd buzzing early Thursday night when they dropped the gloves and slugged it out for more than 20 seconds in a game the Sharks won in overtime.

title: 📸 Oregon leads Week 9 CFB threads
content: The crowd theme for Oregon's game against Wisconsin this week is tie-dye, and the Ducks are incorporating a number of Grateful Dead motifs into their uniforms.

title: USWNT's shock loss to Portugal shows lack of problem-solving, but no cause for alarm (yet)
content: The surprising loss to Portugal by the U.S. women's national team came from players who admit they were "on islands" and "trying to fix it on their own."

title: The best and worst NFL offseasons in hindsight: Barnwell stacks all 32 teams into seven tiers
content: The Colts' deal for Daniel Jones looks great now; the Texans' OL deals do not. Let's review every team's signings, trades, hirings and draft picks with hindsight.

title: SEC title? Top one-loss team? Who wins the Heisman? We stack the most interesting races left in the season﻿
content: We have just over a month until Selection Day and these battles for CFP slots and major awards should be fun.

title: Week 9 preview: Conference title contenders, key matchups and more
content: Our college football experts provide insight on conference title contenders and key matchups ahead of Week 9.

title: Top 100 men's NCAA basketball players going into 2025-26
content: From seniors who have taken the national stage before to freshmen entering the spotlight, here is our 1-100.

title: Bilas' 2025 preseason All-America teams
content: From three transfers on the first team to four freshmen on the second, here are Jay Bilas' All-America teams.

title: Jaylen Brown serves as pre-audition judge for Druski's 'Coulda Been Records' Boston auditions
content: The Boston Celtics guard held power in passing contestants to the next round of auditions for the comedy rap competition.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 8
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Five positive trends that will continue: D'Andre Swift leads the way
content: Highlighting players such as Swift, who are enjoying a good run in fantasy recently, and why it will continue.

title: Arsenal, PSG show why they are the favorites: Making sense of Champions League Matchday 3
content: Champions League MD3 was about the goals, and lots of them: 71 across 18 games, to be precise, with some statement wins for tournament favorites (Arsenal, PSG) and big clubs that needed a lift (Liverpool). Let's break it down.

title: Dest's starting spot with the USMNT doesn't look as secure as it once did
content: There's no denying Sergiño Dest's talent, but amid defensive shortcomings and disciplinary issues, he might no longer be a lock to start at right back.

title: Survivor pool strategy: Colts, Patriots among top options in Week 8
content: NFL survivor pool strategy, predictions and picks for ESPN Eliminator Challenge Week 8, including teams to pick or save for later.

title: Steelers' 1933 striped throwbacks, Chargers' navy look top NFL Week 8 uniforms
content: It's the debut of a throwback uniform for the Steelers in Week 8, while the Eagles will also be wearing kelly green.

title: NFL Week 8's fashionable arrivals, featuring Justin Jefferson
content: From suits to streetwear, Week 8's arrivals mixed personal flair and cold-weather layers with comfort and creativity.

title: Heavyweight fights we want to see in 2026: Fury-Joshua, more
content: Heavyweight Joseph Parker defends his interim title Saturday, but what other big fights can the division make in 2026?

title: Preseason transfer impact rankings
content: The top 25 transfers, ranked by impact this season -- beginning with South Carolina's Ta'Niya Latson.

title: Why Clásico could hinge on battle between Madrid's Bellingham and Barça's Pedri
content: Jude Bellingham and Pedri both dreamed as kids of being Clásico heroes. Whichever one outplays the other on Sunday will drive their team to victory.

title: Clásico injury update: Will Huijsen, Raphinha return for Real Madrid-Barcelona?
content: Real Madrid host Barca in the first Clásico of the season on Sunday. Both teams have plenty of injury concerns.

title: Championship picture, schedule, stats and facts
content: Formula 1 ventures to Mexico City for round 20 of the 2025 season. Find out how the championship shapes up and everything you need to know for the weekend.

title: Leaving IndyCar for F2 sets Colton Herta up for F1 -- if he ever gets the call
content: American Colton Herta is leaving IndyCar to join Formula 2, so if the Cadillac test driver ever gets his shot in F1, he can hit the ground running.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona keeping tabs on Álvarez
content: Barcelona are exploring a possibility to sign Atlético Madrid striker Julián Álvarez. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: New low-pressure area forms over Bay of Bengal, to bring heavy rain to Tamil Nadu
content: According to the latest RMC bulletin, under the influence of an upper-air cyclonic circulation over the southeast Bay of Bengal and the adjoining south Andaman Sea, a low-pressure area has formed over the southeast Bay of Bengal as of 5.30 a.m. on Friday (October 24)

title: ED summons actors Srikanth, Krishna for questioning in cocaine case
content: Sources said that actors Srikanth and Krishna will have to appear before the officers of the ED on Monday (October 27, 2025) and Tuesday (October 28)

title: Kurnool bus accident: The bus caught fire when it was raining; all statutory permits were valid
content: The vehicle, owned by Vemuri Kaveri Travels had fulfilled all major statutory requirements, fitness, tax and insurance for operation

title: Bhopal administration prohibits use of carbide guns after children suffer eye injuries
content: A Prohibitory Order restricts manufacture, storage, sale, or purchase of noisy firecrackers and carbide guns made using explosive materials

title: Kurnool bus tragedy occurred due to overspeed and negligence
content: Fire officials received call around 3 a.m, says Fire Services In-charge Director General P. Venkata Ramana

title: Kurnool bus fire accident: Telangana’s Gadwal Collector announces control room numbers
content: According to a communication from the Telangana Government at 9.45 a.m.,  there were a total of 43 passengers. Of them 23 escaped. Bodies of 11 passengers were found

title: Delhi Police arrests 2 suspected ISIS operatives plotting attack in capital
content: The accused, both named Adnan and hailing from Bhopal, were arrested based on specific intelligence inputs following a coordinated operation in Delhi's Sadiq Nagar and Bhopal, a senior police officer said

title: Language route to a better future: A.P. nursing graduates learn German
content: The nursing graduates, mostly from poor families, are undertaking government-funded language training in the hope of securing a well-paid job in Germany. Foreign language training introduced in 13 government nursing colleges

title: Kurnool bus fire tragedy: Telangana sets up helpline for victims’ families
content: Telangana government has announced the establishment of helpline numbers to assist families of passengers involved in the tragic bus fire accident

title: Imperative to ensure accountability for recurring incidents: Congress after Andhra bus fire incident
content: Passenger safety is a top priority, and it is essential to ensure accountability for these accidents, along with responsibility for vehicle maintenance, says Congress leader Rahul Gandhi

title: Piyush Pandey, advertising world doyen, passes away
content: Piyush Pandey started his advertising journey in 1982 with Ogilvy & Mather India (now Ogilvy India), as a trainee account executive before transitioning to the creative side

title: PM Modi condoles deaths in Andhra bus fire, announces ex-gratia
content: At least 12 persons were killed after a private bus heading towards Hyderabad caught fire after colliding with a two-wheeler near Chinnatekur in Kurnool district

title: Kurnool bus accident: Odisha-registered bus involved; Telangana Transport Department extends support
content: The officials said the bus had accumulated e-challans to the tune of ₹23,120 for violations such as overspeeding, driving on the wrong side of the road, and obstruction of the carriageway

title: Beyond Hyderabad: Telangana’s smaller cities step into the IT spotlight
content: As Telangana’s tech sector expands beyond Hyderabad, Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities are emerging as new hubs. With government-backed IT towers, incubation centres, targeted incentives and infrastructure support, cities like Warangal, Karimnagar, Khammam and Nizamabad are attracting companies and tapping into the local talent pool. P. Laxma Reddy and P. Sridhar explore how these cities are becoming viable alternatives to the capital while fostering decentralised, inclusive IT growth across the State

title: It was a life-and-death situation: Survivor recounts horror of Kurnool bus fire
content: Over 25 passengers were reportedly charred to death and several others injured when the private bus travelling from Hyderabad to Bengaluru went up in flames after a collision

title: Murder cases against bus owners if a repeat of Kurnool happens: Minister
content: Please don’t play with the lives of the people by trying to operate buses with poor quality. We will not hesitate to book murder cases against you, says Telangana Transport Minister Ponnam Prabhakar

title: Journalist hacked to death in Prayagraj, accused arrested after encounter
content: Additional Commissioner of Police, Ajay Pal Sharma, said on Friday that evidence from the crime scene and statements of the eyewitnesses revealed that the attack on Singh was carried out by Vishal along with a few others.

title: Gangster carrying ₹1 lakh bounty killed in police encounter in Uttar Pradesh’s Shamli
content: Teams from Jhinjhana police station and the district's SWAT unit intercepted the accused during a check, leading to an exchange of fire in which Faisal sustained gunshot wounds

title: Watch: Kurnool Bus Fire: Over 25 killed as luxury bus catches fire in Andhra Pradesh
content: A tragic bus fire in Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh, has claimed over 25 lives and left several injured. The Hyderabad-Bengaluru sleeper coach caught fire after colliding with a motorbike in the early hours of October 24.

title: Leaders express shock over tragic bus fire in Kurnool district
content: Former Chief Minister and YSRCP President Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy conveyed heartfelt condolences to the families who lost their loved ones and urged the government to extend all possible assistance and medical support to the injured and affected families.

title: Kurnool bus fire LIVE updates: PM Modi announces ex gratia to affected people and their families
content: Ex gratia of ₹2 lakh from PMNRF would be given to the next of kin of each deceased. The injured would be given Rs 50,000,” Prime Minister Modi said

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: Tejashwi promises corruption-free government, accuses Centre of backing criminals
content: The Prime Minister will start the election campaign from Samastipur, the birthplace of Bharat Ratna Karpoori Thakur, who served as Chief Minister of Bihar in the 1970s and was awarded the highest civilian honour this year.

title: Bengaluru-bound bus catches fire: Andhra and Telangana CMs express condolences
content: Over 25 passengers were reportedly charred to death and several others were injured when a private bus bound to Bengaluru caught fire in Kurnool

title: Mental health awareness no longer only an urban phenomenon
content: The Karnataka Tele-MANAS cell, part of the National Tele Mental Health Programme, has seen calls multiply nearly 60-fold since its inception in 2022, with rural areas increasingly making up a significant proportion of the calls, highlighting both rising awareness and the growing burden of mental health issues outside cities, writes Rishita Khanna.

title: 25 reportedly killed as Bengaluru-bound bus catches fire after bike collision near Kurnool
content: The private sleeper coach was carrying around 40 passengers when it caught fire after colliding with a motorbike in the opposite direction around 3.30 a.m.

title: CBI conducts second round of searches at suspended Punjab DIG’s residence
content: The fresh operation at Mr. Bhullar's Sector 40 residence came amid reports that he was not cooperating with the agency

title: A fine arts college in Chennai that is a cradle of modern Indian art
content: The Government College of Fine Arts was established in 1850 as Madras School of Arts. It was first located on Popham’s Broadway. After coming under the Department of Public Instruction in 1852, it shifted to its present campus on Poonamallee High Road, now known as E.V.R. Periyar Salai. Over the years, it has shaped generations of artists who influenced the cultural identity of Tamil Nadu

title: When Jayalalithaa spoke out against an AIR ban on Ilaiyaraaja’s Oram Po Song and Khomeini
content: In an article published in the September 15, 1979 edition of Thuglak, the former Chief Minister launched a scathing critique of Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini for banning all music from the country’s radio and television. She also panned All India Radio for banning the song from Tamil film Ponnu  Oorukku Pudusu

title: 75 years ago, 22 Communist prisoners were shot dead in Salem Central Jail during riots
content: Around 12.35 p.m. on February 11, 1950, Communist prisoners started rioting in the jail annexe, prompting prison officials to open fire. Besides the fatalities, 102 prisoners and 21 jail staff members were injured. Decades after the massacre, Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has announced the construction of a memorial for the 22 Communists

title: Vedanta Group to invest ₹1,00,000 crore in Odisha
content: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal met Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi and discussed proposed industrial projects

title: Cooch Behar SP shunted after assault against those bursting crackers draws condemnation
content: Dyutiman Bhattacharya, SP of Cooch Behar was accused of beating up several people, including children and women, for bursting firecrackers on Deepavali night (October 20) near his official residence.

title: Fresh Ponzi scam surfaces in West Bengal’s Asansol, ₹350 crore siphoned
content: LOP Suvendu Adhikari demanded the arrest of Tahsin Ahmed, the accused behind chit fund scam, return of money of the investors and investigation by SEBI-ED into the money trails.

title: Several including government officers injured in attack in Tripura’s Surma, Chief Minister blames Tipra Motha supporters.
content: Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha condemned the incident and said the administration has been directed to take swift action against those responsible

title: North Tamil Nadu likely to get intense rainfall from October 26
content: According to the Regional Meteorological Centre, Chennai and its surrounding districts along with Ranipet are likely to receive heavy rainfall between October 26 and 28

title: Around 1,000 doctors, medical staff take part in network hospitals’ strike
content: The total sum to be paid to the network hospitals, which provide free treatments to public under Dr. NTR Vaidya Seva scheme, is around ₹2,700 crore

title: Bihar voters must choose between NDA’s vikas and INDIA bloc’s vinaash: Nadda
content: BJP chief launches sharp attack against alleged corruption by RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav, the CM face of the Opposition alliance; mocks RJD’s employment promises given land-for-jobs scam case against Mr. Yadav

title: APTF seeks exemption from TET requirement
content: File a review petition in the Supreme Court demanding exemption from the mandatory requirement to pass the test

title: Kerala government signs up for PM SHRI funds amidst CPI opposition
content: CPI State secretary Binoy Viswam says signing up for PM-SHRI without taking LDF into confidence is a brazen violation of coalition ethics

title: Efforts under way to develop Penuganchiprolu,  Ibrahimpatnam mandals, says official
content: Two mandals among the 500 mandals selected nationwide for overall development, says National Water Mission Director

title: Piyush Goyal hopes for India-U.S. trade deal in ‘near future’
content: The Union Minister is in Berlin at the moment, following a short trip to Geneva to speak at the 16th session of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development

title: Unions, farmers unite against drafts of labour policy, Electricity (Amendment) Bill
content: The CTUs and SKM reiterated their resolve to continue coordinated actions to challenge the pro-corporate, anti-worker, and anti-farmer policies of the Central Government

title: Former TTD Chairman receives notices from police
content: Bhumana Karunakar Reddy claims coalition government taking revenge by filing fake cases against him for revealing about the deaths of more than 100 cows at the TTD Goshala

title: A.P. CM woos UAE investments in petrochemical, energy, food processing sectors
content: Abu Dhabi National Oil Company agrees to develop a clear roadmap for technological collaboration with Andhra Pradesh; Chandrababu Naidu invites UAE industry leaders to the upcoming Partnership Summit in Visakhapatnam

title: Vikassheel Insaan Party’s Mukesh Sahani: For a former set designer, it’s the stuff of a Bollywood film
content: Mr. Sahani, who quit the Mahagatbandhan in 2020 alleging ‘betrayal’, is now the alliance’s Deputy Chief Minister face; the move is aimed at garnering maximum votes, especially in North Bihar where the alliance performed poorly 2020

title: Actor Lakshmi Menon petitions HC to quash case against her
content: The court had recently granted anticipatory bail to Ms. Menon and others who had been arraigned as accused in the case that was registered by the Ernakulam North police

title: Asean summit: PM Modi to attend virtually; Congress takes a swipe
content: the ostensible reason for the rare miss to the summit by Modi might be preoccupation with the bihar assembly elections . he also spares him the discomfiture of running into the mercurial president in the middle of a US-India trade deadlock .

title: Kerala government contemplating centralised purchase of cardiac cath lab consumables
content: Plan to purchase consumables for all cath labs in the State’s public health sector directly from medical devices firms through the Kerala State Medical Services Corporation

title: AICC appoints new in-charge for Indian Youth Congress
content: The outgoing in-charge of IYC, Krishna Allavaru, is currently the in-charge for party affairs in Bihar, where Assembly elections are to be held

title: DCGI brings in stricter norms for tracking supply chain of high-risk solvents
content: The order, issued earlier this week, comes following serious safety concerns after the alleged death of over 20 children due to contamination of cough syrups with Diethylene Glycol recently in Madhya Pradesh

title: Priyanka warns against shifting Thirunelli Ashram school students to Aralam
content: Scheduled Tribes Development department shifts 32 girls to Kaniyambetta MRS; district administration sets up four bio-toilets at Government Ashram High School, Thirunelli

title: Private drivers of BMTC electric buses stage protest over salary delays
content: The protest is the latest in a series of demonstrations by drivers operating BMTC electric buses under private operators

title: NDA, Mahagatbandhan establish powerful dominance, shrinking space for others
content: Since the 2015 election, the two fronts have been the principal players in Bihar’s political landscape; the strength and appeal of these formations are such that those who tried their luck independently could not sustain themselves; entry of JSP has triggered talk about a possible end to the duopoly

title: US sanctions: Curbs hit home; RIL, PSUs set to suspend Russia imports
content: Determine the monthly installment amount for a loan Estimate the returns on investments made through SIPs Find out maturity amount and interest earned on PPF Check maturity amount and interest earned on an FD Estimate the pension amount and corpus accumulated under NPS A Mutual Fund Calculator helps estimate the future value of investments

title: Tomato prices in Pakistan surge over 400%: What’s driving the spike? Explained
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Live Updates: Bengaluru-Bound Bus With 40 Onboard Catches Fire After Hitting Bike, 12 Dead
content: Hyderabad-Bengaluru Bus Accident LIVE News Updates: At least 12 people died after a Bengaluru-bound private bus caught fire and turned into ashes after hitting a bike in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool in the early hours of Friday.

title: Piyush Pandey, Man Behind Iconic Fevicol, Cadbury Ads, Dies At 70
content: Advertising legend Piyush Pandey died on Friday. The man behind the iconic advertisements of Fevicol, Cadbury, and Asian Paints was 70.

title: Hyderabad-Bengaluru Bus Crash Revives Memories Of Deadly 2013 Volvo Accident
content: A late-night journey from Hyderabad to Bengaluru ended in tragedy on Friday when a private Volvo bus caught fire after colliding with a two-wheeler near Chinnatekur village in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool district.

title: Elon Musk's "If She's A 10" Remark On "Silicon Valley Sex Warfare" Report
content: The world's richest man, Elon Musk, has reacted to a report claiming Chinese and Russian operatives are targeting the American tech industry through deception and seduction.

title: "Woke Up To Flames, It Spread Rapidly": Survivors Narrate Deadly Bus Fire
content: Harika was asleep when the Volvo bus she was travelling in caught fire early this morning. Startled by the chaos, she woke up to find the flames had almost engulfed the vehicle.

title: Bhopal, Gwalior Ban 'Carbide Guns' After Many Lose Eyesight On Diwali
content: Two districts in Madhya Pradesh- Gwalior and Bhopal- have banned the sale, purchase, and storage of carbide pipe guns after they caused eye injuries to nearly 300 people in the state during Diwali celebrations.

title: Rajasthan Official Suspended For Slapping Fuel Pump Staff In Viral Video
content: The Rajasthan government has suspended a state civil service officer for allegedly slapping a CNG pump staffer in Bhilwara after an altercation, a video clip of which went viral on social media, officials said.

title: Who Was Vaishnav Krishnakumar, Indian Teen With Golden Visa Who Died In Dubai
content: An 18-year-old Indian student from Middlesex University Dubai died of cardiac arrest during Diwali celebrations in the city.

title: Maharashtra Woman Doctor Dies By Suicide At Hospital Amid Rift With Cops
content: A woman doctor allegedly died by suicide at a district hospital in Maharashtra's Satara on Thursday night, police said on Friday.

title: Indian-Origin Man Faces 15 Years In US Prison For Moonlighting
content: Mehul Goswami, a 39-year-old Indian-origin New Yorker, was arrested by the US authorities on charges of "grand larceny" for moonlighting as a contractor while he was working for the New York State Office of Information Technology Services.

title: 25-Year-Old Elephant Knocks Down Electric Pole, Dies Of Shock In Coimbatore
content: In yet another tragic incident highlighting the growing conflict between humans and wildlife, a 25-year-old elephant was found dead of electrocution near Thondamuthur in Coimbatore district early Thursday.

title: NDTV Exclusive: What Spending 24 Hours Inside A Gaza Refugee Tent Looks Like
content: Before the war, Esraa's world was full of colour. Her husband worked at a large store that sold art supplies and toys. She herself painted intricate designs on glass cups and ceramic plates, sold her crafts online, and worked in digital marketing.

title: PM Modi, President Condole Deaths in Kurnool Bus Fire
content: At least 11 people died early Friday as a Volvo bus caught fire after it hit a two-wheeler in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool. Leaders across the political spectrum condoled the loss of lives in the bus tragedy.

title: 20 Jumped Out Of Bus When It Caught Fire: What We Know About Hyderabad-Bengaluru Crash
content: The bus travelling from Hyderabad to Bengaluru met with an accident and caught fire. The visuals from the ground show charred bus.

title: Indian, 18, With Golden Visa, Dies Of Cardiac Arrest In Dubai On Diwali
content: An 18-year-old Indian student, recipient of the UAE Golden Visa, died of cardiac arrest in Dubai during Diwali celebrations, local media reported.

title: India-US Scholar Ashley Tellis Denies China Link In Espionage Case, Gets Pre-Trial Release
content: A US court has granted pre-trial release to Indian-American scholar Ashley Tellis in a purported espionage case.

title: US Accuses Ex-Executive Of Selling Trade Secrets To Russia For $1.3 Million
content: US prosecutors have accused a former executive of a government contractor that provides cyber intelligence tools to federal agencies of selling trade secrets to a buyer in Russia for $1.3 million.

title: Alaska Airlines Grounds Its Aircraft Due To Technology Outage
content: An information technology outage has prompted Alaska Airlines to ground its planes, the airline said Thursday.

title: Journalist Hacked To Death Near Prayagraj Hotel: Police
content: A 54-year-old journalist was hacked to death by unidentified assailants near a hotel here, police said.

title: India Scaled Back On Russian Oil Purchases On Trump's Request: White House
content: United States President Donald Trump has been "increasingly frustrated" with the lack of progress on putting an end to the Russia-Ukraine war, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said on Thursday (local time) during a press briefing here.

title: Ranking every open Power 4 job in college football
content: all four power conferences have had a firing in the first half of the season . no coach is safe, but a strong line of storms has been forecasted . a total of 298-150 coaches have been fired from the power conference .

title: UCL talking points: Conte's rant, Liverpool's best XI, who is Clásico-ready?
content: the UEFA champions league returned with a bang this midweek . we had big wins for arsenal ( 4-0 vs. Atlético Madrid ), Paris Saint-Germain ( 7-2 at Bayer Leverkusen ), PSV Eindhoven ( 6-2 . Napoli ), Barcelona ( 6-1 v. Olympiacos ), Chelsea and Liverpool ( 5-1 at Eintracht Frankfurt . ESPN writers Mark Ogden, Julien Laurens, Tom Hamilton and Gab Marcotti

title: Who will win Dodgers-Blue Jays World Series? MLB scouts, execs and managers make their predictions
content: the Toronto Blue Jays host the los Angeles Dodgers in Game 1 on friday . the 2025 world series is nearly upon us . what should you expect from the team's pitching staff? which X factors will determine this October's last team standing?

title: Coaching tracker for 2026: Toronto Tempo hire Sandy Brondello
content: the Dallas Wings , New York Liberty and Seattle Storm all cut ties with their head coaches . the expansion Toronto Tempo and Portland Fire joined the WNBA next year . ESPN will track all of the hirings and firings, and provide analysis, as they happen .

title: Buzz for Week 8: The latest on the trade deadline, QB futures, more
content: the "Get Up" crew weighs in on the state of the Dolphins . insiders Jeremy Fowler and Dan Graziano have been making calls to sources around the league . they asked around about two struggling AFC East teams, the 0-7 Jets and the 1-6 .

title: Experts' picks and best bets: Is anyone taking Ciryl Gane to upset Tom Aspinall?
content: aspinall will make his anticipated return to the Octagon against former interim champion Ciryl Gane on saturday . he owns the UFC record for shortest average fight time at 2 minutes, 2 seconds . the heavyweight is taking on the fourth-mostaccurate heavyweight in UFC history .

title: VUL's Newman keeps drawing complaints and controversy
content: a former coach is accused of using false promises to lure athletes and coaches to a historically black private university in Virginia . he has worked as a football coach and athletic director since 2021 . some of the lawsuit allegations are denied by the university's attorney in a court filing .

title: What if Ohtani WAS on that plane to Toronto? Inside an alternate World Series universe
content: Shohei Ohtani and Vladimir Guerrero will be at the plate for the 2025 world series . there is another world, one not as far-fetched as you might think . Roki Sasaki could be playing the part of rookie sensation for the Blue Jays .

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: a year ago, the WNBA players' association announced the players would opt out of their current collective bargaining agreement with the league that was set to expire following the 2025 season . the players outlined their desire for a new economic model based on equity . there are no signs a deal will be put in place by the date that the current deal expires, on Oct. 31 .

title: Rodgers plans to retire with Packers when done
content: Aaron Rodgers has said he's "pretty sure" this season with the Pittsburgh Steelers will be his last . he says he will retire a Packer and see what happens after that . "i've got a lot of love for the organization and my time there," he said .

title: Answering 22 questions on the Billups, Rozier arrests: What happens now?
content: former NBA player and coach damon Jones indicted in sports betting and rigged poker games . two separate cases involve current and former NBA players . prosecutors allege rigging poker games against high rollers after enticing them to play with former players including Jones and Billups .

title: Justin Herbert, Kimani Vidal lead Chargers in commanding win over Vikings
content: the Los Angeles Chargers beat the Minnesota Vikings 37-10 on friday night . they played their worst game of the season in a pummeling of Minnesota . the Charger's only win was a 29-27 victory over the lifeless 1-6 Miami Dolphins .
